description: Luffy's hometown in the East Blue, where he grew up and first met Shanks. A peaceful village on Dawn Island.

keyEvents.title: Garp Returns to Foosha Village
keyEvents.description: Vice Admiral Garp returns to the village after the Marineford War to check on the residents and ensure their safety.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the aftermath of the war reaching even the peaceful East Blue.

keyEvents.title: Dadan Confronts Garp
keyEvents.description: Dadan attacks Garp in the village, blaming him for Ace's death in an emotional confrontation.
keyEvents.significance: The village becomes a place where grief over Ace is expressed openly.

description: An island inhabited entirely by the Kuja tribe of warrior women, located in the Calm Belt. The island is protected by the Kuja Pirates and ruled by Boa Hancock.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Attacks Jinbe
keyEvents.description: On the shores of Amazon Lily, Luffy, consumed by grief, attacks Jinbe in desperation.
keyEvents.significance: The island serves as the location for Luffy's emotional breakdown and recovery.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Tearful Cry
keyEvents.description: Luffy's emotional cry of wanting to see his crew echoes across Amazon Lily.
keyEvents.significance: Amazon Lily becomes the place where Luffy begins his emotional recovery and finds his resolve to reunite with his crew.

statusHistory.reason: Island continues to serve as home to the Kuja tribe

description: The second half of the Grand Line, known as the New World. A dangerous sea region where the strongest pirates and the Four Emperors reside.

keyEvents.title: Burial of Ace and Whitebeard
keyEvents.description: The Red Hair Pirates and Whitebeard Pirates conduct funeral ceremonies for Ace and Whitebeard in the New World.
keyEvents.significance: The New World serves as the final resting place for two legendary figures, marking the end of an era.

statusHistory.reason: The New World continues to be the most dangerous sea in the One Piece world
